intro: Erucastrum elatum var. microspermum, commonly known as the small-seeded bladder campion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of pink or white flowers, which are typically arranged in racemes. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, contributing to its classification as a member of the Caryophyllaceae family. This species is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
